I live in Norway. There it is always cold.
ayya (m.): Norway janapade vasāmi. Tatra sītaṁ sabbadā.

ayya (m.): Idha pubbaṇhasamaye ca sīto hoti, majjhanhikasamaye ca uṇho hoti.

Welcome, Sir! May the master come here. I hope you are not tired?
ayya (m.): Svāgataṁ bhante. Ayyo idha āgacchatu. Kacci'si appakilamathena?

ayya (m.): Taṁ kissa hetu? Na ajj'āccuṇhaṃ / ajjūṇho.

ayya (m.): Piṇḍāya caritvā / gatvā, bahu khādanīyaṁ paṭiggahetvā / labbhitvā, me patto garo.

master; gentleman; sir: I got more food than Ven. Kovilo. I will share with him.
ayya (m.): Kovilā atirekataraṁ āhāraṁ labbhāmi. Ahaṁ tena vibhajissāmi.

master; gentleman; sir: Please sit here. Where does the master go for alms?
ayya (m.): Ettheva / Idha nisīdatha. Kuhiṁ / Kathaṁ piṇḍāya ayyo gacchatha?

master; gentleman; sir: In the town called Ericeira, there is the market. I go there for alms.
ayya (m.): Gāme Ericeira nāmo, atthi antarāpaṇo. Tatra piṇḍāya gacchāmi.

master; gentleman; sir: What can I do for you, Sir?
Having taken my bowl, the alms should be shared with the bhikkhus.
ayya (m.): Me pattaṁ gahetvā / ādāya, piṇḍaṁ bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ saṁvibhajitabbaṁ.

master; gentleman; sir: If you want water, please tell me Sir.
ayya (m.): Bhāseyya, sace te bhante, udakena attho.

ayya (m.): Ettheva bhante, tiṭṭha / tiṭṭhatha. (Taṁ taṁ) āharissāmi.
